title: saucectl image runner configuration
description: Configuration file for running container images using saucectl

sauce.description: All settings related to how tests are run and identified in the Sauce Labs platform.

region.description: Which Sauce Labs data center to target.

tunnel.description: SauceCTL supports using Sauce Connect to establish a secure connection when running your tests on Sauce Labs. To do so, launch a tunnel; then provide the identifier in this property.

owner.description: The owner (username) of the tunnel. Must be specified if the user that created the tunnel differs from the user that is running the tests.

suite.description: The set of properties providing details about how to run the container.

name.description: The name of the test suite.

image.description: The name of the container image.

imagePullAuth.description: Container registry credentials for accessing the image.

entrypoint.description: The command line arguments to launch the image with.

files.description: List of files that you'd like saucectl to upload and mount within the container.

dst.description: Path within the container that the file should be mounted at.

artifacts.description: List of file paths within the container to be made available as downloadable artifacts.

env.description: Set one or more environment variables.

workload.description: Sets the kind of workload that is being executed

resourceProfile.description: Sets the CPU/memory limits of the container. Format is <CPU><level><mem><level>. Default to c1m1.

metadata.description: Supply additional metadata to your runner.

defaults.description: Settings that are applied onto every suite as a default value.
